title: How Trump Decided to Strike Iran
summary: When Israel began its assault on Iran, President Trump kept his distance. But within days he was on a path that led to an extensive bombing mission aided by political and military ruses.

title: In Dallas, a MAGA Summit for Young Women Pushes for ‘Less Burnout, More Babies’
summary: The wellness influencer universe is resonating with people who might not otherwise be drawn to politics.

title: Democrats to Protest Trump’s Takeover of Kennedy Center With Pride Event
summary: “This is our way of reoccupying the Kennedy Center,” said Jeffrey Seller of “Hamilton,” who was asked to stage the invite-only concert hosted by five senators.

title: The Closing Arguments of the N.Y.C. Mayoral Candidates
summary: Ahead of the June 24 primary, The New York Times analyzed the closing campaign speeches of the four leading Democrats running for mayor.

title: As Black New Yorkers Move Out, N.Y.C. Politics May Be Reshaped
summary: Housing affordability and quality-of-life concerns are pushing longtime Black New Yorkers out of the city, underscoring Democrats’ challenges with their base ahead of the mayoral election.

title: Vera Rubin Telescope Quickly Found 1,200 New Asteroids
summary: The Vera C. Rubin Observatory is expected to find millions of unknown objects in our solar system, and perhaps even a mysterious Planet Nine.

title: Vera Rubin’s Legacy Lives On in a Troubled Scientific Landscape
summary: A powerful new telescope will usher in a new era of cosmic discovery, but in a political climate vastly different from when it was named for a once overlooked female astronomer.

title: The MTV Reality Star in Trump’s Cabinet Who Wants You to Have More Kids
summary: Sean Duffy, once the resident playboy on “The Real World,” is now a father of nine who presents his family as an example for America.

title: How Hugo Aguilar Ortiz Became Mexico’s Most Powerful Indigenous Lawyer
summary: Hugo Aguilar Ortiz grew up in a remote Mixtec-speaking village. He is now one of the most powerful lawyers in Mexico.

title: Quién es Hugo Aguilar Ortiz, que presidirá la Suprema Corte de México
summary: Hugo Aguilar Ortiz se ha convertido en una de las figuras indígenas más visibles de México y en un símbolo de la reestructuración del poder judicial impulsada por el partido gobernante en el país.

title: The Dalai Lama at 90: His Nation Faces a Moment of Truth
summary: The Tibetan spiritual leader has vowed to reveal a succession plan when his birthday is celebrated on July 6. He may get creative to thwart Chinese interference.

title: How Iran Might Strike Back
summary: Among the most likely options are asymmetric or terrorist attacks, although the time frame is impossible to gauge.

title: Can We See Our Future in China’s Cameras?
summary: Promises of safety and convenience belie the machinery of political abuse.

title: Inside Trump’s Decision
summary: The Times pieced together the days and hours leading up to President Trump’s decision to strike Iran. It’s a story of diplomacy, deception and a secret that almost got out.

title: Supreme Court to Hear Rastafarian Prisoner’s Suit Over Shaved Dreadlocks
summary: Damon Landor, whose faith requires him to let his hair grow long, said guards threw a court ruling in the trash before holding him down and shaving his head to the scalp.

title: US Heat Wave: Latest Forecast for the East Coast
summary: The next few days will bring the hottest temperatures of the year so far to much of the Eastern U.S.

title: Nearly 150 Report Being Jabbed With Needles at French Music Festival
summary: France’s Interior Ministry reported that 145 people said they had been stabbed with needles at festival events across the country.

title: U.K. to Ban Palestine Action Group as Terrorist Organization
summary: The British government announced plans to proscribe Palestine Action after members broke into a military air base.
